Yes, there has been growing recognition of the importance of diversity and inclusivity in various spheres of life, including schools, media, public policies, and communities. Efforts to diversify our social spaces by promoting inclusion, equity, and representation of all groups help promote acceptance and foster integration into a more diverse and pluralistic society. Some examples of progress made in this regard include:

1. Representation in media: There has been growing awareness of the need for diverse representation in the media, including television, film, and advertising.

2. Education: Many schools and organizations are now implementing more proactive efforts to promote diversity in academic settings, and greater inclusivity and accessibility to education for different groups that have traditionally face barriers.

3. Public policies: Governments have been working to promote diversity and inclusion through policies that promote equal rights, more equitable access to healthcare, housing, and other vital services.

All these efforts help promote a more equitable, diverse, and inclusive society where differences are not only accepted but celebrated.
